column5: Port Maitland Walleye Report Just thought i would let ya no there is still a ton of Walleye off Port Maitland..fish are moven deeper ive been fishing 85 to 110 fow seems to be the ticket ...small dipsy off the boards 250 to 300 back on a 2 or 3 setting . big dipsy on a 1 and 2 setting 150 to 175 back all with the ring...should be a good weekend for the tourney ....thanks Ed Kelly and gang for joining me on Lake Erie it was rough but the Eye's made for a good day ... Fishmaster Ultimate Charter's http://www.mountiancable.net/~fishmaster
good report with some nice fish landed
wow awesome fish
Nothing like free advertising eh FM??
those are some nice eyes!!!  great job  cheers!
Not looking for free addvertiseing ....just trying to help others catch fish and were they are hitting saves people gas money looking ....got and muskie tips for board members
I remember somebody called out somene for posting the same message on "mulitble boards" before

You know guys... Steve catches fish, and is always willing to help other people catch fish. If you ask him where on Erie to catch fish, he'll point you in the right direction no questions asked.  He posts pretty much weekly with what is being caught and usually with what they are catching fish on, yet all we hear from some people is spam spam spam.  Why don't we just enjoy the posts and pics from someone who is dedicated their whole life to fishing and does it pretty much everyday.  It's funny how other professional guides who post reports on here always get a pat on the back, even though they have all their "contact info" in their signatures.  Really guys... stop all the fricken whining and go out and catch some fish. I think some of you are just jealous personally.  cd.

Ya - what Corey said. He is always the first to give tips for Lake Erie and Ontario. I personally do not feel this is spam - I love to read his posts.  Keep up the good work Fishmaster! Look forward to your next report   Don
Is it me or does anyone here see the guy with the corona t-shirt holding a Walleye with bugged out eyes?  The 7th pic down from the top.
Depending upon where you put your fingers under the gill plate, it's easy to bug their eyes out. Those fish aren't being released so I guess it doesn't matter. Good catch.

WOW !!!!!!  right on steve...thats what i call goin walleye fishing...lol..lol.  . looks like some real nice erie eyes great pics as welland you can tell in a few pics she was rough out there,and some happy customers....dont worry steve we dont think you are spamming.they obviously dont know you..thats bull.  .anyway thanks for sharing,man i would love to get down there and fish with you someday soon...i cant wait in a few weeks to go to quinte, there is a great catch of resident fish ....take care ...cheers
I have redacted my comment on Spam...  Steve is a PAID advertiser on our board.. therfor he is supporting us having this board to use and enjoy  I say post away!  Gerritt.

just a little ditty on steve's behalf,,,i wouldn't have caught half the fish i have this year without his help!!  which was free!!  Anytime i have talked with him he is morre then willing to let me know the depthes or where or what they are hitting on!!  I enjoy his posts to find out whats going on in my area and how the fishing has been...So corey,,,cudoes for sticking up for whats right,,,,thats one of the reasons why we are all here,,,to learn,,,and if it has to be someone who makes his living fishing then so be it,,,,who better??

Thanks for all the kind words guys ...i would try to help out any angler catch fish its a big bodie of water and finding walleye or salmon can be tough on days .....if i can help i will anytime Thanks Again Steve aka Fishmaster
I look forward to your reports every week! Keep 'em coming! HH
Yes this Walleye came from down deep and when the get brought up to fast thats what happens bug eyes ...and there blatter sticking out there mouth like they ate a ballon

Wow, small world!  I know those guys (Ed, Ian etc) they just rented my cottage a couple of weeks ago.  Surprising to open this post and see their photos.  Looks like they had a great day (I'll have to find out why I wasn't invited!)

Yepp - Always a pleasure to read fishmasters reports!  If I had a boat they'd be extremely helpful to me and you can't help but enjoy the smiles on the faces of his guests!  Keep it up FM.  Cheers, UF

Dito..  Any professional that comes on and gives tips etc is always welcome in my books.  if it was the second post ok spamm. but jeez not like the post was come ye all to my business.   Now can you please give me the best GPS spots to catch a walleye  jk.
~~~~Having never phished Erie before, any info is well recieved. Not asking to bait my hooks, but an idea as to what to use is always helpful. Thanks Steve, keep posting, great pics
Nice catch!  Probably the reason why you are the "Fishmaster".
Those are some nice pickeral!Looks like a lot of fun!
